column4: then why when I redo the apt-get install it not downloading them again?
did that I try again, I also did apt-get update & try apt-cache ??  whats the command to clear apt-cache?
ther is a command 2 clear the cache & its not clean
no the package casche  is what I ened 2 clear Apt-cache commandhere <---
It does not clear everything thats my point
ther is a apt-cache command I am not getting it to download teh java packages
ok so you want to refresh the package lists?
wait you mean oher than the package cache?
apt-get clean clears the package cache, the directory in /var/cache/apt/archives/
thre's also apt-get autoclean which clears everythign except newest versions of stuff
not how it works, and he already parted
since youre saying that you arent seeing certain packages available to install, it sounds like you dont want to clear the package cache, but rather refresh the apt cache, and that is "apt-get update"
